parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

returnParameters.description: new map containing result of applying parameter `func` to each member

functions.name: 'map

returnParameters.description: a new map of [key, member] pairs

functions.name: entries
functions.description:
Returns a map containing [key, member] pair as the value for each key.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50}.entries() â‡’ {"Carl":["Carl",85],"Bob":["Bob",50]}
```

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each element to test whether it should be included

returnParameters.description: new map containing members for which parameter `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each member

functions.name: forEach
get
functions.description:
Returns the member of a map with given key.

This for use in a case where it is known that the map has a specific key,
and accordingly panics if parameter `m` does not have a member with parameter `k` key.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.get("Carl") â‡’ 85
marks.get("John") â‡’ panic
```

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `m` has a member with key parameter `k`

functions.name: hasKey
functions.description:
Tests whether a map value has a member with a given key.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.hasKey("Carl") â‡’ true
marks.hasKey("John") â‡’ false
```

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object that will iterate over the members of parameter `m`

functions.name: iterator

returnParameters.description: a new list of all keys

functions.name: keys
functions.description:
Returns a list of all the keys of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.keys() â‡’ ["Carl","Bob","Max"]
```

functions.name: length
functions.description:
Returns number of members of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.length() â‡’ 3
```

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: initial value for the first argument of combining parameter `func`

returnParameters.description: result of combining the members of parameter `m` using parameter `func`

functions.name: reduce
functions.description:
Combines the members of a map using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the map,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.reduce(isolated function (int total, int next) returns int => total + next, 0) â‡’ 195
```

returnParameters.description: the member of parameter `m` that had key parameter `k`

functions.name: remove
functions.description:
Removes a member of a map.

This removes the member of parameter `m` with key parameter `k` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.remove("Carl") â‡’ 85
marks â‡’ {"Bob":50,"Max":60}
marks.remove("John") â‡’ panic
```

functions.name: removeAll

returnParameters.description: the member of parameter `m` that had key parameter `k`, or `()` if parameter `m` does not have a key parameter `k`

functions.name: removeIfHasKey

returnParameters.description: an array whose members are the members of parameter `m`

functions.name: toArray
functions.description:
Returns a list of all the members of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.toArray() â‡’ [85,50,60]
```

types.name: Type
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

types.name: Type1
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `any|error`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: The `lang.map` module corresponds to the `mapping` basic type.
modules.description:
## Module overview

The `lang.map` module corresponds to the `mapping` basic type.
The `lang.map` module corresponds to the `mapping` basic type.

functions.description:
Returns a map containing [key, member] pair as the value for each key.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50}.entries() â‡’ {"Carl":["Carl",85],"Bob":["Bob",50]}
```

Returns the member of a map with given key.

This for use in a case where it is known that the map has a specific key,
and accordingly panics if parameter `m` does not have a member with parameter `k` key.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.get("Carl") â‡’ 85
marks.get("John") â‡’ panic
```

Tests whether a map value has a member with a given key.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.hasKey("Carl") â‡’ true
marks.hasKey("John") â‡’ false
```

Returns a list of all the keys of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.keys() â‡’ ["Carl","Bob","Max"]
```

Returns number of members of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.length() â‡’ 3
```

Combines the members of a map using a combining function.

The combining function takes the combined value so far and a member of the map,
and returns a new combined value.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.reduce(isolated function (int total, int next) returns int => total + next, 0) â‡’ 195
```

Removes a member of a map.

This removes the member of parameter `m` with key parameter `k` and returns it.
It panics if there is no such member.

```ballerina
map<int> marks = {"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60};
marks.remove("Carl") â‡’ 85
marks â‡’ {"Bob":50,"Max":60}
marks.remove("John") â‡’ panic
```

Returns a list of all the members of a map.

```ballerina
{"Carl": 85, "Bob": 50, "Max": 60}.toArray() â‡’ [85,50,60]
```

all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.
